library.description: Parse and stringify URL query strings.
library.name: query-string

library.description:
Negative array index support using ES6 Proxy.

var a=[1,2,3]; a[-1] //=> 3
library.name: negative-array

library.description: Stringify an object/array like JSON.stringify just without all the double-quotes. Useful for when you want to get the string representation of an object in a formatted way.
library.name: stringify-object

library.description: Generate random numbers that are consecutively unique.
library.name: unique-random

library.description: Detect the indentation of some code. Useful if you need to persist indentation or have new content match existing indentation.
library.name: detect-indent

library.description:
RaptorJS is an open-source toolkit for building JavaScript modules and UI components that function on the server and in the browser. RaptorJS promotes modularity, which is crucial to building reasonably complex HTML web applications that are maintainable, easily testable, and optimized. The central goal of RaptorJS is to enable applications to provide the best user experience.

As an eBay project, RaptorJS was designed to be extremely efficient and lightweight. Rather than being a monolithic framework, RaptorJS embraces a modular design; it is intended to work alongside existing JavaScript libraries—not replace them.
library.name: RaptorJS

library.description: Parse and stringify the HTML  srcset attribute.
library.name: srcset

library.description: Polymer is a new type of library for the web, built on top of Web Components, and designed to leverage the evolving web platform on modern browsers.
library.name: Polymer

library.description:
Detect if DevTools is open.

Useful for when you want something special to happen when DevTools is open. Like pausing canvas, adding style debug info, etc.
library.name: devtools-detect

library.description: ComponentJS is a stand-alone MPL-licensed Open Source library for JavaScript, providing a powerful run-time Component System for hierarchically structuring the User-Interface (UI) dialogs of complex HTML5-based Rich Clients (aka Single-Page-Apps) — under maximum applied Separation of Concerns (SoC) architecture principle, through optional Model, View and Controller component roles, with sophisticated hierarchical Event, Service, Hook, Model, Socket and Property mechanisms, and fully independent and agnostic of the particular UI widget toolkit.
library.name: ComponentJS
